medical_history.chief_complaint: Significant per-incisional pain and inability to tolerate oral intake.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient presents with abdominal pain that worsened with multiple episodes of bilious emesis. Patient reports being unable to get out of bed due to pain, particularly around the umbilical incision site. Symptoms followed a recent laparoscopic converted to open cholecystectomy.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Alcohol abuse, gallstone pancreatitis s/p ERCP with stent placement and sphincterotomy, recurrent episodes of cholecystitis s/p laparoscopic converted to open cholecystectomy, asthma, and alcoholic hepatitis.
medical_history.social_history: Patient has a history of alcohol abuse and recently consumed 4 shots of vodka after being in rehab.
